title: Camus
description: Reflecting the profound influence he continues to exert on popular consciousness, Camus examines the complete body of works of French author and philosopher Albert Camus, providing a comprehensive analysis of Camus’ most important works―most notably The Myth of Sisyphus , The Stranger , The Fall , The Plague , and The Rebel ―within the framework of his basic ethical orientation.
author: David   Sherman
